Subject: Re: [junit] How to run setUp() only once for all the Test Cases


> But where is the oneTimeSetUp() class defined ? OR do I have to implement
> this class ?
yes, you have to implement this method.It runs before each test suite is
called.

>If yes, then how do I specify to call setUp() only once ?
setUp() is called before every test. If you have nothing to be done before
every test runs,leave the implementation empty.

The idea of having a "oneTimeSetup()" is to put the objects which the tests
operate on,in some kind of *state*. setup(),on the other hand create
data/objects required for each test.
One cannot (easily,atleast) change setup() to be called before each suite of
tests.

It seems that what u want to do,is run a method that creates your test
fixtures before running a "suite of tests". You can call it any name you
want( except setUp() ),and call it like the faq describes it below.

ciao
